awd_titl_txt: Workshop for Chairpersons of Computer Science/Engineering   Departments at Minority Institutions; November 17-19, 1988; Atlanta, Georgia
awd_abstract_narration: This project involves a two day workshop in Atlanta for Chairpersons of         Computer Science or Computer Engineering Departments from all minority          institutions which grant a baccalaureate degree in computer science or          engineering.  Further, one additional person (e.g., the Academic Vice-          President) from each institution will be invited using institutional            funds.  The purpose of the workshop is to:                                                                                                                                                                                                           Acquaint the participants with relevant support programs in the                 Computer and Information Science and Engineering (CISE)                         directorate of the National Science Foundation.                                                                                                                 Seek advice on support programs needed by predominantly minority                institutions to strengthen both research and academic programs in               activities supported by the Computer and Information Science and                Engineering Directorate.                                                                                                                                        Conduct an intense proposal writing and evaluation workshop using               draft proposals developed prior to the workshop by participants                 and evaluated by participant reviewers and NSF staff.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
